channel.title: Exception on The Python Corner
channel.description: Recent content in Exception on The Python Corner

item.title: Working with Exception in Python
item.description: According to the official documentation, an exception is “an error detected during execution not unconditionally fatal”. Let’s start the interpreter and write: 1>>> 5/0 2Traceback (most recent call last): 3 File "<pyshell#7>", line 1, in <module> 4 5/0 5ZeroDivisionError: division by zero As you can see we asked the interpreter to divide the number 5 by 0. Even if our request was syntactically correct when the interpreter tried to compute it, it “raised” the ZeroDivisionError exception to signal us that we asked something impossible.
